turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: That has my work number, my home number, my pager number. I sleep three hours a night. Call me whenever you want to talk. Off the air, on the air, whenever. Okay?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Um, yeah -- thanks.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Now look. Don't freeze up on me. I picked you because you had kind of a relaxed, go-with-the-flow quality. You're not going to lose that, are you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, uh...

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I bet my career on you. You'd better be good.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't say that. That's like... telling a guy before you have sex you'd better be good. You don't do that.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Yes, Ed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Could we just talk alone for a second? I --

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Good idea.  Could you all leave us alone for a few minutes?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: How you doing, Ed?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I feel like when I was a kid and my mother sent me to school in orange corduroy pants.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Uh-huh?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And all the kids stared calling me "Pumpkin Ass." "Hey Pumpkin Ass," -- for like a year. So, now, I feel like everyone's watching me and, you know, I'm "Pumpkin Ass" again.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Can I give you one bit of advice? About Shari?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: A woman wants to be pursued.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: They tore her dress! ...

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: We're going to get you a bodyguard, don't worry. Ed, I have some news for you. We're picking up Ed TV for another month!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah?!

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: That means a balloon payment and a big raise for the second month.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Stand back -- I'm about to do my Happy Dance.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You asked me if I had a dream. I said "Sure, I have a dream. I just don't know what it is yet."

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Great line.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What if Shari's the dream?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ed, do you want my advice?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, that's why I called. I mean, maybe Fed-Ex would tell me where she moved --

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Leave her be.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You said a woman likes to be pursued.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Pursued, not harassed. Give it some space. Can I tell you something -- as a friend? My sister was going with a guy they hit a little rough spot they started seeing other people they got back together and last month they had their third child For what it's worth.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ed, everything goes off. "Cheers" went off. "Mash" went off --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, but when they went off people weren't making fun of them. They weren't bozos! I'm Pumpkin Ass again!

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ed --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, everything you asked me to do I did. I call you for advice about Shari you say -  "Leave her be, see other people for a while." You just wanted me to get involved with Jill because it made for a better show.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ed --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. You screwed up my life just so you could get higher ratings. You never gave a shit about me.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Yeah? Well I'm not starting now.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. Because, you didn't talk me into anything. Everything you wanted me to do, I wanted to do.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: He's who we want to go with.

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: This guy.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I polled my staff. The men say they'd hang around with him and the women say he's fuckable. And one of the men said he's fuckable.

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: I'm not sure about the entire concept.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Take him off the air.

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: What are you talking about? He's fine. He's out of the hospital already. The ratings are higher than ever.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I'm telling you, it's peaked. Ed TV is an over-inflated balloon. Get it off before it explodes all over us.

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: With all due respect, Cynthia you're nuts. I'm giving him another month!

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Isn't this getting kind of pathetic. I mean we drank the juice, now we're just licking peel. Let it go!

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: Cynthia, I think you're laboring under a misconception. You seem to believe that because you happened to predict this, we should be impressed. We're not. Anybody in any business can predict failure. 1 need people who prevent failure. I want to see this thing turned back in the right direction. Remember this was your baby.

turns.speaker: SCHARLACH
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I've got this great idea. We put together a video. "The Network Executives Goofiest Moments." And listen, i've really loved working here.

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: Mr. Pekurny.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: I'm Dr. Geller. Your mother is just lying down for a few minutes. we gave her something to calm her down.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Thank you. Can I see her?

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: Just wait here. She's coming right back out.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Mm...  Oh, man...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What about him -- did he suffer any or was it quick? I'd hate to think he...

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: Very quick. Between you and me, it's not a bad way to go. Making love to your wife... it's very sweet.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really? They were..

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: According to your mother. When the paramedics got to the hotel, she told them that --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hotel? What were they doing in a hotel?

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: I ... don't know. I ...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I thought -- I thought he was dead.

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Al!

turns.speaker: DR. GELLER
turns.text: No.  The deceased is ... Henry Pekurny.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Look at this -- people are getting married, they're getting married...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You said that.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're falling behind.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know who we are?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tell me.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're the guys who clean up after the parade.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm gonna stick this right in your eye.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I was at this comedy club last week and this comedian says "If you're over thirty and your job requires you to wear a name tag, you screwed up your life." And I'm laughing and then I realize I wear a nametag.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So do I. So what? I'm doing all right.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Your brother's here.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, that thing. Yeah. Did you hear about this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, what - they put some schmuck on TV all day long or something?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, if it's free, it's me.  You ready?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah. You did good. What's wrong?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Aah, I wanted Shari to come.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh -- so I'm just, what -- a poor substitute?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  Honey, if you're watching this is for you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No! Don't --  Oh, wow.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know about that fireman who rescued that little girl?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: When? Today?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No! Like, ten years ago. In Texas. Baby...  Jessica!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh right, right! She fell down, like a...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, a thing. He became a big hero. He was on TV and there was a parade and a movie about him

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right, right...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And then, uh... you know it blew over and he went back to being a fireman again.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So he killed himself.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Eddie? ...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Are the TV people with you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. The camera guy is here.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Send him away.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Send him? Ma, I can't. it's -- just come out here. Please, I --

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Do you want us to come in the kitchen?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: No. It's a mess.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, Ma, come on out. Really. I need to talk to you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ma, do you know where Ray is? I've been calling him and I'm getting his machine and --

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Eddie, how could you do it? Your brother's girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, he cheated on her.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: He made a mistake.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't want to -- do you know where he is?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: No. Maybe he's watching.  Tell him you're sorry. Tell him you'11 stay away from that girl.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No! And that girl has a name.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I know you. This Shari is a passing fancy.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No! I -- All right, look, if you hear from Ray.... tell him to call me, okay?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: How's Marcia? She all right?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I don't know. She's living with that "entertainer"...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, who knows? Maybe she finally picked a winner this time.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Mm.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You and Al lived together a few months before you got married -- after Dad left.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Oh my God!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I mean, that worked out.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Oh my God!!

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I can't believe you're taking his side.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm not! I'm just trying to get some facts.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I told you the facts! He abandoned us -- those are the facts.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So everything he told me yesterday was a lie. Everything.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes to me or yes to the coil?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Both.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Holy sh--

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: He had girlfriends!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: He says --

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I don't care what he says. Look, I don't need to relive this. On television!

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: All right -- do you want to know the truth? I took you and Marcia and Ray to my sister's on the train for the weekend and you all got chicken pox. So I took you home a day early and there was your father with a woman in our bed. Okay?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Chicken pox? I was six. He didn't leave 'til I was twelve.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: He... apologized, he begged me. He can be very... charming when it suits his purpose.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But what was that whole story about him and a nurse?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: She could've been a nurse.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Could've been a nurse?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: She had white shoes.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So does Grandma. So does Shaquille O'Neal. You told me you had a hysterectomy and he ran off with your nurse.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: What's the difference?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The difference is for twenty years I thought one thing and now it's another thing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh my God. You and Al were - and that's why you threw him out.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: He had a woman in my own bed! And how dare you call him "Dad" in front of Al.  This is your father. This is who was there for you when you needed someone.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: If I don't call you "Dad" it' just because... 1 was already a big boy when you came into our lives --  or when I thought you came into our lives --

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: And what did he come back now for?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Hank! All of a sudden. Because now you're famous and he can get something from you. I don't wan you to become a victim like Marcia.  Not that you're a victim, honey. You're not. Life's just been a little hard on you, sweetie.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you think. I mean about... him. Should I just... have nothing to do with him? I mean...

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Eddie...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I'm at the hospital.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's the matter?!

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: He's dead! Eddie, he's dead! It was his heart.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh God. What hospital?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: St. Joseph's.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm coming right over. I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: It was horrible. He called me up.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Hank! He said he wanted to talk to me to apologize for everything he begged -- he cried. So I went to this horrible hotel he was staying in... I felt so sorry for him --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So you had sex with him?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The doctor said you were having sex.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: To you? In front of him?  With the...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes. He assumed Hank was your husband. He didn't know.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Oh my god! On TV!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Why? How...

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: One thing led to another. He was my husband once.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But Al is your husband now!

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Do you think it's been easy for me? It's been years. Al can't have sex.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Apparently, neither can Hank. What the hell did you do to him?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Don't tell Al. He doesn't know.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, he's the only one in America who doesn't!

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Ed! How did you know I was here?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You're famous. Somebody called me. What are you doing in a place like this?

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: Why shouldn't I be in a place like this? I'm a whore!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ma...

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I'm a tramp  Meet your new father. The whole nation is laughing at us!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And how is this helping? come on say, good-night to all your new friends and let's go home.

turns.speaker: JEANETTE
turns.text: I'm a whore!  Your bathrooms are filthy!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's going on over there?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Everybody's making audition tapes for that Real TV thing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Right, yeah --

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She really doesn't want you and the camera in here right now.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, I understand. That's - where is she, is she all right?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Hi, Mom.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Shari, Ray feels --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hi. Is Shari here?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What is she, at work?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She left.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, when will she be back?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She won't.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She left. She moved. She got Fed-Ex to give her a transfer and she left. She couldn't stand it anymore. We had people, news people, regular people, just sleeping in our hallway, going through our mail, our garbage. I mean it was she couldn't take it anymore. Now I've got to move. I can't afford this place by myself.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm sorry. Where'd they send her?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She wouldn't tell me.

turns.speaker: MR. SCHARLACH
turns.text: Well, Ed, that's ... not really possible.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: All right, I'11 pay for the parking. Big network!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I can't?

turns.speaker: MR. SCHARLACH
turns.text: Well, no. You agreed to stay on the air as long as we asked you to. The station entered into this on that understanding. If you had refused we'd have begun this with somebody else. You can't just change the rules in the middle of the game, son. It's not fair to us. More importantly, it's not fair to the viewers. They're interested in you. They've devoted hours and days and weeks of their lives to you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, if you don't let me out of this... I'11 just... I'11 just sit in my apartment all day. I won't go anywhere, I won't do anything. What kind of show will that be?

turns.speaker: MR. SCHARLACH
turns.text: Not too good. That's why it states in your contract that if you do not continue to live a normal life, you're in violation and are liable for the station's financial losses. Ed, I urge you to reconsider. I urge you on behalf of all those people out there whose lives have become so entwined with yours. Play fair with them, Ed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: All right. Let them decide.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No! I barely even mentioned -it's just that, my friends, the people at work, whoever I'm regularly in contact with they want releases from.

turns.speaker: MARCIA
turns.text: They're gonna mock our foibles.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Our what?

turns.speaker: MARCIA
turns.text: Our foibles, our foibles!

turns.speaker: MARCIA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hm? I'm, uh... Why isn't this drunken woman you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh! Oh -- okay, now I get it. It's "Star Search." You wanted me here because the camera comes with me.

turns.speaker: MARCIA
turns.text: Ed, he needs a break. You don't know what kind of bad luck he's had --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I can imagine. You said you wanted nothing to do with this. You swore to me. "Don't come near me. Don't bring this into my life..."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Are you asking me?

turns.speaker: FELICIA
turns.text: No, I mean...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What does this mean?

turns.speaker: FELICIA
turns.text: It means they hate his freaking guts. It means if he were on fire they wouldn't put him out.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: He's just ... trying a little too hard --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: How much less?

turns.speaker: FELICIA
turns.text: Never would be plenty.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I can't do that to him. He's pushing a little too hard - but... I just can't do that to him.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Um, yeah, I was gonna ...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's the deal? Did anybody make a decision -

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Ed, look, uh... you're not getting the job. They're gonna transfer someone from another store to manage this store when I leave to manage the new store. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, Christ. Did you go to bat for me?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: I batted!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You batted or you bunted?

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Hey. I went as far as I felt comfortable. I mean, you know, let's face it -- you come and go here as you please. You work when you feel like it -- you know, Bruce Springsteen's birthday is not a legal holiday.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, then I'm quitting.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Ed, come on. What's that gonna do? You're gonna bring Blockbuster to their knees. Let me recommend a movie to you. It's called "Get your shit together before it's too late."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who's in it?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, Lou.

turns.speaker: LOU
turns.text: Welcome to work, Ed.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I hear the dog really liked him.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Oh, the whole family loved him. Of course, they loved the last guy I went out with, and he strung me along for three years and dumped me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really? You see, to me, you shouldn't have any trouble with men. There should be, like, a line behind you.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Are you sure about this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, believe me -1 know I've got a great chance of making a fool of myself, here.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Why do it?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I saw this show once. It was about logging. I was home sick, there was nothing else on. Do you know how they break up really bad log jams? You know, when they're really tangled... ?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Cream rinse?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dynamite.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So maybe this is my dynamite.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Dynamite is dangerous.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You do though, you look great.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, no, I -- as soon as you came in tonight I said to John, "Boy Shari looks beautiful." I said it on TV so you can ask anybody who saw it.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: What do you want?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Shari, I'm just really sorry. Look, I know this is... unbelievably awkward, but if I could come in for like a second and -- you know -- just say... two words, then...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Don't defend that horse's ass to me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm not. I'm not. I'm just Look -- you know, in a way, it's good. He got this out of his system now and he knows it's not worth it and, you know, someday if you guys got married or something --

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Ha!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Okay ...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I've got news for you-- I never intended to marry him.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh... how come?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I mean bad.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, not having been there... I just think you're hurt and you're saying this to, you know, get back at him.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Oh my God.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's... okay

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I kissed my boyfriend's brother on television!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, when you put it that way.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Leave. Go.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Can't we just --

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Go!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: All right. Okay. I'11 ... see you.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah. I mean for months I've been seeing you with Ray you being his girlfriend and I kept wishing you were my girlfriend... But, you know, what could I do?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Me too. I mean I'm going out with Ray and I'm... thinking about you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Oh God, this is so weird.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Weird? If this happened last month it would've been weird. Now with... the TV and... now it's just too weird.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I missed you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, I never saw you in your uniform before.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Yeah, well...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's really a tremendous turnoff.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: You should see the one we wear when it rains.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sunday night at the Devils game, I'm driving the Zamboni.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You know, the big machine that cleans the ice.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Oh yeah.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's quite an honor. Will you come with me?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh -- Sunday is good for me to meet your folks. We get a big family audience on Sundays so it works out.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: That's lucky.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Saturday, I think we should

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I wish my stepfather was here.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: He could give me some oxygen.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Um...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I told you. If we... you know do it, they go away until ... we're done.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I know, but even if they go away, everybody in America knows what we're doing because... they went away.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So? What do they think -- we're not kids --

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I know, I ...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Shari, I really like you...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I really like you too...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: ...if this ...  ... weren't here... ?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: ... yeah, then, but...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Ed... I think we should stop seeing each other.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I have no privacy. Even now! I'm crying and I can't stop and they won't go away. And now it's going to be another month!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Shari...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Everybody hates me!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. Who?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Look at this.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Page three of the Post.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ohh...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: A poll. "Is Shari Good Enough for Ed?" Seventy-one per cent said "no."  They hate me!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who cares? I don't ca -- No. I do care.  Shame on everybody. Shame on you! Well, just the seventy-one percent. The other...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Twenty-nine.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Exactly. Boy, you're smart.  Why are you so mean to her? What did she do to you?  "Is she good enough for Ed?" Who the hell am I?  Who the hell do you think I should be dating?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: There's a list.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Ed?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I tried to tell you over the phone -- my parents went to Atlantic City.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: So my little brother's staying here. I'm sleeping with Rita.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh Je -- couldn't he sleep with Rita? We'11 all have a good time.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Come on, let's go.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Somewhere.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: I feel like a criminal or, like we're cheating on someone.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Just... just relax. Okay? We won't do anything. We'11 just sit here for a while.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Come on...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I need to talk.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: She lied to me. I mean all my life, she's telling me one story and then... it turns out to be a completely different story. Come to me at some point -- tell me the truth. No. Not in my house. The truth is a stranger. And this is why Ray and Marcia are the way they are. Marcia gets involved with all these losers and sees no problem with herself - "How do they find me" she says. Ray cheats on you and then blames me for it. I'm the only one in the family who takes any responsibility for himself... Oh, man... Are you all right?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Yeah... I saw that girl come on to you at the TV show.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh that was... no, I ... she just kind of trapped me into giving her a ride. It's you. I want you.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: ...yeah?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's not their fault.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: No. It's your fault.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you want me to do? You want me to quit the show?!

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: No... Could you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. If I quit I don't get the balloon payment.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ray borrowed this whole tub of money against this balloon payment that I don't get if I qu -- it's too complicated. I -- Besides...

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You see how people look at me. Like when they ask for my autograph or say "Hi" to me... It's like I'm a basketball player or a... you know, like I'm someone.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: Everybody's someone.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, yeah, everybody's someone. But I mean someone they want to be. I mean let's face it, I'm working in the video store, no one's coming in saying "oh, I wish I was that guy. 1 wish was rewinding that huge pile of tapes." At least for a month I'm not just a guy with a name tag. I'm famous.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: This is going right up your ass.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Kinda'.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: It's what I do. I yell "Geronimo" and jump out of a relationship.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: You weren't able to make me feel safe or secure -- no easy job for any  man, I admit -- and my problem is, if I think I'm losing, I pull myself out of the game. I bail. See? I told you, I'm the love coroner.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What did you do to your hair?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: My truck overheated, so I opened the hood and my hair got caught in the fan belt. So I had to get a haircut.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's nice.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Let's have a contest. Now this would mostly be open to professional investigators and detectives. But anyone can join in.

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: What do we have to do?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: My lovely assistant, Shari. I'm glad you asked. The contest is who can dig up -- legally, of course -- I'm not suggesting that anyone break any laws -- the most embarrassing and humiliating facts about any of the executives here at the North American Broadcasting System which owns Real TV.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But facts! They have to be verified. Anything from their past, their present, business, personal -- arrests, affairs ... And whoever comes up with the sleaziest, most degrading material -- I'11 give you ten thousand dollars. And you get to be on Ed TV.  Hah?

turns.speaker: SHARI
turns.text: So act now. Here's Ed's home phone number.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I was... having dinner with Shari and her parents.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you mean all of a sudden? You've been going with her six months.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I know. I mean I'm sitting there and her father's asking me about my "career prospects" and I'm playing "Risk," with her kid brother, Leon and at dinner the dog's sniffing at my balls -- at least I hope it was the dog. 'Cause her mother disappeared for a while.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You know, that would be like a great thing.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That! Being that guy. Being the guy they watch.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What are you drunk?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah, but let's stay on one subject. Whoever that person is is going to be famous. They'll be able to get whatever they want. They'll ... trust me, this is my business.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What is?!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Show business.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You're in show business?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah. I service video equipment.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's like... those people stitching Nikes in Panama saying they're in the NBA.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not stitching Nikes in Panama! ... Bedwetter!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Thumbsucker!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm making a tape.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We're excited.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I got your message. Way to go!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hi, Shari.  Let's go in the stockroom.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I ... I'm not gonna do it.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look -- there's a million ways to humiliate yourself - I gotta think of a new way? I mean, it's all day! Every minute. Id be like a monkey at the zoo. I just...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh man! They couldn't pick me! They had to pick you!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You would do this? You would actually --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: In a second! In a hot second. Let me ask you something --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Why do you do that?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Whenever you ask me something why do you always say "Let me ask you something?" Why don't you just ask me?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: All right. Let me ask you something... are you happy like this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm doing all right.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh Yeah? What's your master plan here?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're gonna be a video store clerk for the rest of your life? This is your big ambition, rearranging the "Ernest" movies?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Screw off.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How many opportunities are you going to get in your life?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's right. You don't know. Doors don't fly open for guys like us.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey. You know-- we're not the same. I got a good life, this job suits me. I come and go when I please --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh, don't bullshit a bullshitter. If you're happy like this you're an idiot, and you're not an idiot.  Hi.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Polish acrobat.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey. Check this out.  Look at this.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Okay, I just wanted to get your attention. My name is Ray and my friend Bucky and I design video systems. You've got an office or a big home, we'11 come out there design you an entire system.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: See, they should've picked him. Look how comfortable he is out there.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hey, Ed. Did you hear about Marcia?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No. What happened?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: That's our sister.  She's got a new boyfriend.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ray, maybe this isn't ...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: No, this is great.  You'll love this.  He's a singer.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Marcia's living with a singer?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah. You know, piano bars. plays the piano and sings. That's how they met.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I mean my question is what was she doing in a bar in the first place?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ray --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: She's an alcoholic, for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, Jesus.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Remember the last guy she got involved with? What was his name?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's the dif --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Richie!  She spent six months dating a criminal

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: She didn't know he was a criminal. They had a relationship. They --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: "Quick pull off the highway" is not a relationship. Oh man, I gotta pee.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What are you, hiding from the Police?  Show your face, you look great.  Doesn't she look great.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: While I'm gone, tell them about our cousin Lenny who's gay. We knew from when he was five.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's me, Ed.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You watching the ballgame?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Uh, no, uh I'm a little tired. I fell asleep.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh. All right. I'11 watch at home, then.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hello... Shari, hi... Oh no! ... Oh God!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We'd better go...
